pullRequest.title: Allow binding an annotated service method without a path
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation:

Allows binding even when empty or default values are specified in HTTP method annotation.

Modifications:

Remove non-failure test cases
If @Path is not specified, but there is no path value to specify, an empty value is added
Add handling when pathPattern is empty in RouteBuilder

Result:

Closed #2708

commit.message: Allow binding an annotated service method without a path #2708Allow binding an annotated service method without a path (#2708)
Remove non-failure test cases / Add successful test cases

nodes.bodyText: pathPattern is never null. Use pathPattern.isEmpty().
This is used in only one place. How about embedding it and leave a comment?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -168,6 +168,11 @@
                     .put(Trace.class, HttpMethod.TRACE)
                     .build();
 
+    /**
+     * A value to specify if HTTP method annotation value is empty or not specified.
+     */
+    private static final String EMPTY_PATH = "";

nodes.bodyText: IIUC, httpMethodPaths seems not to be empty here. Could remove this if condition?

Could you set up a server using ServerExtension and send real HTTP requests to the server? The test cases in this class does not really ensure the requests will go to the desired service methods.
Could you use a meaningful path instead of /1?
IIUC, ExactPathMapping will throw an  IllegalArgumentException on an empty string.
